data.title: 50 Stories from Ugandan Refugees 1972 Fleeing to the UK
data.meta_description: Ugandan Refugees 1972 UK - 50 Stories from Ugandan Refugees Expulsion in 1972 to mark the 50th Anniversary of Asians Expulsion in London.
data.text:
Ugandan Indian Expulsion Stories #19: GOVINDBHAI’S STORY

“I became Ugandan, and then I became stateless, and then I became British Citizen again” Born in India, Govindbhai moved to Kampala at the age of 11, where he attended…

50 UGANDAN ASIAN REFUGEES STORIES #18: MUNJUBEN’S STORY

“All those dreams and all that work we had done, we just left everything” Born in 1933, Munjuben was 40 when she and her family left Uganda in October 1972.…

50 Ugandan Asian Refugees Stories #17: Surjit’s Story

Home Is Where The Heart Lies. Until he turned eight, Surjit lived a pleasant life in Jinja, Uganda, playing outside and eating local foods with his siblings and friends. It…

50 Ugandan Asian Refugees Stories #16: Shilpa’s Story

The Birthday Gift. Shilpa loved sports as a young girl living in Jinja, Uganda. For her tenth birthday, her father gave her the opportunity to visit London with her friend’s…

50 Ugandan Asian Refugees Stories #15: Pyar’s Story

Community Is The Key. Pyar, like his father before him, lived in the modest settlement of Kaberamaido, Uganda. There he ran a shop with his father and started a family…

50 Ugandan Asian Refugees Stories #14: Akbar’s Story

Keep Calm & Carry On. Until the age of twelve years, Akbar was living life to the fullest in Kampala, Uganda, both in school and during his free time. His…

50 Ugandan Asian Refugees Stories #13: Firoza’s Story

There’s No Place Like Home. Firoza enjoyed her early life in a small village in Uganda, where her spare time was predominated by nature, picnicking by lakes and climbing fruit…

50 Ugandan Asian Refugees Stories #12: Jitu’s Story

Coming Full Circle. Jitu was a hard worker for many organisations across Uganda. He not only enjoyed his working life but also made the most of Uganda’s weather, food and…

50 Ugandan Asian Expulsion Anniversary Stories #11: Narendra’s Story

The Struggles & Successes Of A Salesman. Until the age of thirty-two, Narendra lived in Mbale, Uganda, where he acquired his parents’ keen senses for commerce. He had an enjoyable…

50 Ugandan Asian Expulsion Anniversary Stories #10: Maharani’s Story

The Courage To Fight Back. Maharani was too young to remember much of her life in Uganda. At just three years of age, she was expelled from the country with…

50 Ugandan Asian Expulsion Anniversary Stories #9: Rupal’s Story

A Walk Down Memory Lane. Rupal was happily enjoying a varied and outdoors-oriented childhood in Uganda. She lived in Jinja, in a flat above her family’s business, but went on…

50 Ugandan Asian Expulsion Anniversary Stories #8: Yogesh’s Story

A Diversity Of Experiences Through Work & Play. While living in Jinja as a twelve-year-old boy, Yogesh—the youngest of over ten siblings—had plenty of company with whom he could enjoy…

50 Ugandan Asian Expulsion Anniversary Stories #7: Mukund’s Story

Through Trials & Tribulations, Perseverance Prevails. Until the age of seventeen, Mukund was growing up in Jinja, Uganda, making friends and taking in the country’s outdoor delights. But in 1972,…

50 Ugandan Asian exodus Stories #6: Hansa’s Story

Life Lessons Around The World. Hansa’s life in Jinja, Uganda, was active and family-focused. She enjoyed going out for family walks in the local park, festivals at the temple, and…

50 Ugandan Asian exodus Stories #5: Viresh’s Story

A World Of Wonderful Memories. Welcome to the fifth of our 50 Ugandan Asian Exodus Stories. This story is by Viresh, whose family, like so many others, was impacted by the…
